role.descr: physical location where mutation happen// exon, intron //
changes at molecular level/* always use prepositional phrase */
changes at phenotype level /* secondary predication */

example.text: Analyses of transcription in vivo of agn-lacZ with mutated Dam target sequences support this conclusion.

Cotransfections with plasmids expressing WT-1, WTAR (a mutated form of WT-1), p53, and a mutated form of p53 revealed a complex pattern of regulation with a 3-fold induction with WT-1, a 7-fold induction with mutated p53, and a 4-fold repression with wild-type p53.

In COS-7 cells cotransfected with PKA-Calpha and SOX9 expression plasmids, PKA enhanced the phosphorylation of wild-type SOX9 but did not affect phosphorylation of a SOX9 protein in which the two PKA phosphorylation sites (S (64) and S (211)) were mutated.
Induction of a mutation in the lacI gene will result in the loss of transcriptional repression of the lacZ gene in mutated cells.
example.arg: the loss of transcriptional repression of the lacZ gene in mutated cells

example.text: We have identified five hydrophobic amino acid residues on the ALK4 extracellular domain (Leu40, Ile70, Val73, Leu75, and Pro77) that, when mutated to alanine, have substantial effects on ALK4-trunc dominant negative activity.
example.arg: Leu40, Ile70, Val73, Leu75, and Pro77
have substantial effects on ALK4-trunc dominant negative activity
